Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks if the database is up and running. It does this by making a request to the database, which will raise an exception if it’s not working.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Inject the database session

Returns:

A json object with a message

main.index()¶

The index function is the default function that will be called when a user visits the root of your API. It returns a simple message to let users know that they have successfully connected to your API.

Returns:

A dictionary in json format

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are needed by your app, like connecting to databases or initializing caches.

Returns:

A value that is passed to the fastapi instance

async main.user_agent_ban_middleware(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

The user_agent_ban_middleware function is a middleware function that checks the user-agent header of an incoming request. If the user-agent matches any of the patterns in our ban list, then we return a 403 Forbidden response with an error message. Otherwise, we call next and let FastAPI handle it.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Get the user-agent from the request headers

  • call_next – Callable: Pass the next middleware function in the chain to be called

Returns:

A jsonresponse object if the user_agent matches one of the banned patterns

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactCreateSchema, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactCreateSchema: Validate the body of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the user that is currently logged in

Returns:

A contact object, so the response schema is contactschema

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to delete

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • current_user – User: Ensure that the user is only able to delete contacts that they own

Returns:

A contact object

async src.repository.contacts.get_all_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_all_contacts function returns a list of all contacts in the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify how many rows to skip

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

The get_contact function returns a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact we want to get

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • current_user – User: Ensure that the user is only able to access their own contacts

Returns:

A contact object

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(first_name: str, last_name: str, email: str, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

The search_contacts function searches for contacts in the database.

Parameters:

  • first_name – str: Filter the query by first name

  • last_name – str: Filter the contacts by last name

  • email – str: Filter the query by email

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • current_user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contact objects

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdateSchema, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to update

  • body – ContactUpdateSchema: Pass in the json body of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Make sure that the user is only able to delete

Returns:

The updated contact

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the user’s email address, and the db: asyncsession parameter is used to connect to our database

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_user_by_email function takes an email address and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A single user object

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The update_avatar_url function updates the avatar url of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Identify the user

  • url – str | None: Specify that the url parameter can be either a string or none

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user object

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user object from the database

  • token – str | None: Specify the type of token

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A value of type none

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactCreateSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactCreateSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is currently logged in

:param : Get the contact id from the url :return: A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository

  • current_user – User: Get the user id from the current_user object

:param : Specify the contact id of the contact to be deleted :return: None, which means that the api endpoint will return an empty response

async src.routes.contacts.get_all_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_all_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned to 500

  • offset – int: Specify the offset of the contacts to be returned

  • ge – Set the minimum value for the limit parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the user who sent the request

:param : Get the contact by id :return: A list of contacts

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function is a GET request that returns the contact with the given ID. If no such contact exists, it raises an HTTP 404 error.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact_id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database connection

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

:param : Get the contact id from the url :return: A contact object, which is a pydantic model

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • ge – Specify the minimum value for a parameter

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned to 500

  • offset – int: Skip the first n records

  • ge – Specify a minimum value, and the le parameter is used to specify a maximum value

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

:param : Get the contact id :return: A list of contacts

async src.routes.contacts.get_upcoming_birthdays(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_upcoming_birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthday is within the next week.

Parameters:

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

:param : Get the database session :return: A list of contacts with a birthday between today and the next week

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(first_name: str = Query(None), last_name: str = Query(None), email: str = Query(None), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The search_contacts function searches for contacts in the database.

Parameters:

  • first_name – str: Receive the first name of a contact

  • last_name – str: Filter the contacts by last name

  • email – str: Search for a contact by email

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

:param : Specify the type of data that is expected in the request body :return: A list of contacts

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdateSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • body – ContactUpdateSchema: Get the data from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is currently logged in

:param : Get the contact id :return: A contact object

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_avatar(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_avatar function is used to upload a new avatar for the user.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Receive the file from the client

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository layer

:param : Get the current user from the database :return: The user object with the updated avatar_url field

async src.routes.users.get_user(user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_user function is a dependency that will be injected into the get_current_user function. It will return the user object if it exists, otherwise it will raise an HTTPException with a 401 status code.

Parameters:

user – User: Define the type of the parameter

Returns:

The user object

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address. It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database, and if they do not exist, we return an error message. If they do exist but their account has already been confirmed, we return a success message saying so. Otherwise (if they exist and their account has not yet been confirmed), we update their record in our database by setting &quot;confirmed&quot; to True for that particular record.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A message to the user, which is then displayed on the frontend

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database session

Returns:

A token

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. It takes in a refresh token and returns a new access_token, refresh_token pair. The function first decodes the refresh token to get the email of the user who owns it. It then gets that user from the database and checks if their stored refresh_token matches what was passed in. If not, it raises an error because this means that either:

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the authorization header from the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Connect to the database

Returns:

A dict with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

async src.routes.auth.request_email(username: str, response: Response, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user’s email address. The function takes in a username and returns a response object with the image of an open envelope.

Parameters:

  • username – str: Get the username of the user that is requesting to open their email

  • response – Response: Return a response to the user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A file response, which is a type of response that returns a file

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes in a UserSchema object, which is validated by pydantic. If the email already exists, it raises an HTTPException with status code 409 (Conflict). Otherwise, it hashes the password and creates a new user using create_user from repositories/users.py.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add a background task to the queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A new user
